sentences.en: He could not believe that, had the Englishman known how much he was at risk, he would have hazarded his grandson.
sentences.cn: 他无法相信，如果当时那个英国人知道他冒的风险有多大，他还会让自己的孙子去冒这个险。

sentences.en: He nipped his grandson between his knees.
sentences.cn: 他把孙子夹在双膝当中.

sentences.en: He was just like this old man who had lost his grandson.
sentences.cn: 既然找不到她,正象这老人死了孙子,为谁混呢?

sentences.en: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate of his grandson's capabilities.
sentences.cn: 我对他孙子的能力的判断还不算太离谱。

sentences.en: My grandson has been away since last October.
sentences.cn: 我的孙子自去年10月份就离开了。

sentences.en: My grandson's birthday was on Tuesday.
sentences.cn: 我孙子的生日是星期二。

sentences.en: My little grandson is no trouble at all, but his 6-year-old elder sister is rude and selfish.
sentences.cn: 我的小孙子一点都不让人操心，但是他6岁大的姐姐却野蛮而又自私。

sentences.en: Rumor has it that you have grandson.
Sennacherib's grandson Assurbanipal did actually conquer Egypt in 670 BC.
sentences.cn: 塞纳克里布的孙子亚瑟巴尼帕尔确实在公元前670年攻克埃及.

sentences.en: The castle was rebuilt by his great grandson in 1859.
sentences.cn: 城堡在1859年由他的曾孙重建。

sentences.en: The grandson gave his grandfather his arm and carefully supported him.
sentences.cn: 孙子小心翼翼地扶着爷爷.

sentences.en: The old man hobbled along with the help of his grandson.
sentences.cn: 老人在他的孙子挽扶下蹒跚而行.

sentences.en: The one thing he didn't have was a son. I think he's felt that a grandson is the next best thing.
sentences.cn: 他唯一缺的就是个儿子，我想他觉得有个外孙也不错。

sentences.en: They spoil their only grandson very much.
sentences.cn: 他们非常宠爱他们惟一的孙子.

sentences.en: You could see his grandson toddling around in the garden.
sentences.cn: 你可以看到他的孙子在花园里蹒跚行走.

trans.tran_en: the son of your son or daughter
